The claim that Gerard Rogers: the world's most-pierced person, was killed while passing through a metal detector at LAX airport was found to be false.
The expert: s verdict highlighted that most body jewelry is made of a type of metal that does not set off metal detectors, debunking the notion that piercings can cause inconvenience or harm during the security process.
It was clarified that the world: s most-pierced person is actually a woman named Elaine Davidson, according to the Guinness Book of World Records, and not Gerard M. Rogers as claimed in the fabricated article.
The lack of existence of a spokesperson: Joey Goldsmith" was pointed out, further discrediting the false story.
